explains: v. 哄，劝诱；连哄带劝地得到；小心地摆弄（机器或装置）

sentences.en: The officer spoke yesterday of her role in trying to coax vital information from the young victim.
sentences.cn: 该官员昨天谈起她的职责：设法劝诱那个年轻受害人提供重要信息。

sentences.en: However little there is to eat, he always saves a bit o' his bread to coax his pets.
sentences.cn: 不管吃的有多么少，他总是省下一点他的面包来哄他的宠物。

sentences.en: She had to coax the car along.
sentences.cn: 她得耐着性子发动汽车往前开。
